intro: Zyrphelis hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy zyrphelis, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks. Its hairy leaves and bracted inflorescences are distinctive botanical features. Zyrphelis hirsuta is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and greenhouses.
